Articles.Content:
Hello everyone,

I've been getting back into KSP recently after quite a long break (the old SAS system was just too hard for me), and have been really enjoying a lot of the changes in .9. 

These forums have been a major help in getting me to the point of peeking over the learning wall, so I'd like to issue a general "thank you" to everybody. I'd probably still be stuck trying to establish a circular orbit without you.

I'm in the middle of establishing a Mun and Minimus base as a way to iron out any issues before I send off to Duna. I've already sent over a ScanSat. Recently, I started playing around with Karbonite and also decided to do a probe landing on the Mun with 0 maneuver node use (just to see if I could). The game really starts to get a lot easier after you understand the navball. I always hated it before, but realize now that was only because I didn't understand it properly.

When building a couple parts for the orbital part of my Minimus base, I discovered this:

![Q8LhZSf.png](http://i.imgur.com/Q8LhZSf.png)

I had no idea you could change the output light on the Illuminator Mk 1 & 2, and I haven't seen it mentioned on the forums. Figured I would pass it on, just in case it wasn't common knowledge. 

Is there a journal system built into this forum? Some forums have an area where you can build your own thread. I'd be kind of like the "What did you do today in KSP" thread, but a personal one. Just a place to keep track of my KSP progress (and I dont want to clutter a public area with my shenanigry).

Cheers,

Aser

p.s. How do I do spoiler tags?

Welcome aboard!

And yes, there are actually two places that I can think of where you can do such a thing. The first is the [Blogs](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/blog.php) section, where... It's a blog, you can post stuff there.

The other is the Fanworks section, but in your case, where you specify doing progress reports on your missions, then you want the [Mission Reports](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/55-Mission-Reports) section. Both areas are good places to post stuff in.

Hope that helps! Glad to meetcha!

You can also change the light color on the plane landing gear. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Welcome to the forum, by the way!

> 
> ...
> 
> Hope that helps! Glad to meetcha!

It does. Thank you! It looks like the blogs section was exactly what I needed.

Thanks for the warm welcome guys ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif),

Aser
